abstract: An order from the Transportation Ministry on driver’s-side airbags would lead to the recall of an additional 200,000 vehicles in Japan, the transportation minister said.
snippet: An order from the Transportation Ministry on driver’s-side airbags would lead to the recall of an additional 200,000 vehicles in Japan, the transportation minister said.
lead_paragraph: TOKYO — Japan will follow the United States in forcing automakers to recall all vehicles containing potentially dangerous driver’s-side airbags made by the Takata Corporation, the transportation minister, Akihiro Ohta, announced on Friday, saying the problem put Japan’s car-making reputation at risk along with drivers’ safety.

headline.main: Japan to Ask Automakers to Recall Vehicles With Faulty Takata Airbags
headline.print_headline: Japan to Ask Automakers to Recall Vehicles With Faulty Takata Airbags
